intro: Cynoglossum teheranicum, commonly known as the Persian mouse ear, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
